text: COVID-19 is caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. It primarily spreads through respiratory droplets when an infected person talks, coughs, or sneezes. Common symptoms include fever, cough, and difficulty breathing.
Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease caused by Plasmodium parasites. It is transmitted through the bites of infected Anopheles mosquitoes. Prevention includes using mosquito nets and repellents.

Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs. It is spread through airborne droplets when a person with active TB coughs or sneezes. BCG vaccination provides protection against TB.

Dengue fever is caused by the dengue virus and transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes. Symptoms include high fever, headache, and muscle pain. There is no specific treatment, so prevention through mosquito control is important.
